instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL: What is PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL? This is the voltage coming directly from the charger after going through a transistor. .
definitions.PPVIN_S5_HS_OTHER5V_ISNS: What is PPVIN_S5_HS_OTHER5V_ISNS? PPVIN_S5_HS_OTHER5V_ISNS IS PPBUS_G3H voltage after it has passed through a current sense resistor that supplies the TPS51980 and its associated buck converter with voltage to create the PP5V_S4 power rail..
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.820-3787: What is 820-3787? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Runs without battery, fails to boot with battery
threads.message:
Saw a post from 2016 with the same issue and at the time dukefawks had no solution, hoping this has changed since then :)
With battery connected I can get it to POST and boot half way if I press and hold the power button at least until after POST. Booted a few times from ASD but it powers off or goes into a weird sleep (display off, fans still running) after a minute. If I press thepower button normally the fans chirp and give a quarter spin but nothing else happens.

Testing the board (no battery connected):
Went down the list of power rails and got good measurements from <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> down to <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5_HS_OTHER5V_ISNS</SIGNAL>. For <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL</SIGNAL> I get 16.6V though and the schematic shows me this should be 20V.

Can't track down at which point the voltage drops below the 20V, I tested <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> at F7005 and get the same result with a different magsafe board.
Also took the following readings

<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> pins:
1: 3.42V
2: 0
3: 0
4: 3.4V
5: 3.4V

<TRANSISTOR>Q5410</TRANSISTOR>:
Only get a reading on pin 5 of 3.4V

Where should this journey take me next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Runs without battery, fails to boot with battery
threads.message:
Don't get stuck on the <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> not being 20V. The schematic is not always right (and also I assume its written as 20V just to make sure the engineers design it to handle up to at least 20V). 16.6V sounds about right and if ACOK is high don't worry about it.

How is <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> doing? Voltage with both battery plugged in and without battery? Try to see if this voltage changes after you tried to boot and it crashed
Other then that I wouldn't know for sure but it smells like SMC trouble or random corrosion

EDIT: Also are you using a 87W charger? As I think the voltage for that charger is usually around 20V (But maybe it switches to a lower voltage when its not under high load)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Runs without battery, fails to boot with battery
threads.message: The usual 3662 problem that still has not been figured out.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Runs without battery, fails to boot with battery
threads.message: Thanks [USER="289"]smiba[/USER] but if the Pro's haven't figured this one out yet, I certainly won't with my two months experience :/ Plenty of other machines to work on so will not waste any further time on this one. Thanks for the reply though! I use 85W chargers for everything.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Runs without battery, fails to boot with battery
threads.message: I was working with the wrong information. Issue persists but this is an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-06, not an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
